channel.title: Whats this mean?
channel.description:
[Runtime Error] : Exception: Access violation at address 006549BC in module 'scar.exe'. Read of address 00000000 in line 321 in script C:\Program Files\SCAR 2.03\includes\squig.txt?
i get it when i try to use the dropall function.

item.title: Whats this mean?
item.dc:creator: @Nashi Nashi
item.description:
@Nashi wrote:

its an error in squig in IsTextAt3 function

Read full topic

item.title: Whats this mean?
item.dc:creator: @pistolbob pistolbob
item.description:
@pistolbob wrote:

i know i just love ittt it, it has a good mouse procedure.[br][size=1]Posted at: September 02, 2006, 10:59:22 PM[/size][hr]this is what it says in the squig include [code] ROPALL ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^}
{Will drop all items in your inventory, And also checks For lamps
And boxes}
{^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^}

Procedure DropAll;
Var
c, d : Integer;
Begin
If(LampPresent)Then
Begin
CheckLamp;
wait(random(200) + 400);
If(LampPresent)Then
Begin
CheckLamp;
wait(random(500) + 2000);
If(LampPresent)Then
Begin
LampSkill:= ‘Attack’;
CheckLamp;
End;
End;
End;
If(BoxPresent)Then
CheckBox;
c:= 1;
d:= 1;
Repeat
If(c= 8)Then
Begin
d:= d + 1;
c:= 1;
End;
Dropitem(c, d);
c:= c + 1;
Until(c= 8)And(d= 4);
End;
[/code]

and this was how i was using it

[code]

procedure DropWood;
begin
dropall
end;[/code]

Read full topic

item.title: Whats this mean?
item.dc:creator: @Cheesehunk Cheesehunk
item.description:
@Cheesehunk wrote:

Hmm, try setting the Crosshairs twice. Are you using the Official Runescape client? Maybe post the DropAll; function…

P.S.That include is outdated.

Read full topic
